===Etymology===
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=まきもの|巻く|alt1=巻き|tr1=maki|t1=rolling|pos1=the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||stem or continuative form}} of verb {{ja-l|巻く}} ''maku'', “to roll, to wind”|物|tr2=mono|t2=thing}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

===Pronunciation===
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|訓読み|Kun'yomi}}
* {{ja-accent-common|h|ま|きもの}}<ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[ma̠kimo̞no̞]}}

===Alternative forms===
* {{ja-l|巻き物}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|まきもの}}

# a [[scroll]], a long [[wound-up]] document, painting, or drawing that unrolls [[horizontally]]
# a [[roll]] of [[cloth]]
# a [[food]] that has been [[wound]] into a shape resembling a [[scroll]], such as a [[sushi]] roll or a roll of [[scrambled eggs]]

====Synonyms====
* {{sense|wound-up document, painting, or drawing}} {{ja-r|スクロール}}

====Related terms====
* {{ja-r|掛物|かけもの}}: a [[hanging]] [[scroll]], a scroll that unrolls [[vertically]] for hanging on a wall
